name: Python pty module and spawn function used to spawn sh or bash
description: Uses the Python spawn function to spawn a sh shell followed by a bash shell. Per Volexity, this technique was observed in exploitation of Atlassian Confluence [CVE-2022-26134]. Reference: https://www.volexity.com/blog/2022/06/02/zero-day-exploitation-of-atlassian-confluence

data.command:
which_python=$(which python || which python3 || which python3.9 || which python2)
$which_python -c "import pty;pty.spawn('/bin/sh')"
exit
$which_python -c "import pty;pty.spawn('/bin/bash')"
exit

steps.name: Check dependency 1/1
steps.description: Verify if python is in the environment variable path and attempt to import requests library.

data.command:
which_python=$(which python || which python3 || which python3.9 || which python2); $which_python -V
$which_python -c 'import requests' 2>/dev/null; echo $?

steps.name: Resolve dependency 1/1
steps.description: Verify if python is in the environment variable path and attempt to import requests library.

steps.name: Re-check dependency 1/1
steps.description: Verify if python is in the environment variable path and attempt to import requests library.

data.command:
which_python=$(which python || which python3 || which python3.9 || which python2); $which_python -V
$which_python -c 'import requests' 2>/dev/null; echo $?
